newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada dollar strenthens on off-shore interest.
newsitem.headline: Canada dollar strenthens on off-shore interest.

text.p: The Canadian dollar strengthened to C$1.3659 (US$0.7322) from Tuesday's close of C$1.3680 (US$0.7310) on active interest from off-shore market players, dealers said Wednesday.
"There's been some good cross activity," said Reid Farrill, foreign exchange specialist at CIBC.
Recommendations to buy Canadian dollars and optimism sparked by the Bank of Canada's rate cut last week have prompted activity from Australia and New Zealand, he said.
And a weaker Japanese yen has also focused market attention on North American currencies, he added.
